name: Round the World buffet at the Rio Hotel and Casino

reviews.text: We visited this buffet twice during our stay. We were on the Buffet of Buffets plan (unlimited buffets at 7 different locations for a 24 hour period), and didnt plan on repeating any one buffet but we really liked this one!
reviews.title: So many choices

reviews.text: We had dinner the first time. We waited in line about 20 minutes to get seated. The place was pretty crowded, but they seemed to stagger letting people in to keep the food stations from getting too swamped.
reviews.title: an affordable buffet in vegas
Great food-Worth going off strip
reviews.text: Food: The food was really good. It all looked/tasted fresh. There are TONS of options. They have different sections from different countries. Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Japanese Tepanyaki, American and more.. The desserts were delicious - even had Gelato. Every food item I tried was delicious. They have people stationed at each 'area' and they will answer your questions about food items. It did not taste or look like typical buffet foods, although they did have some of the items you'd find at any other buffet, they had lots of unique items. Something for everyone here!

Brunch: Our second visit was brunch. Many of the same items as the night before, but added breakfast stuff. omelet bar, pancakes, french toast, waffles, egg dishes, bacon, sausages, bagels and pastries, and all the other food, too! We were still pretty stuffed from the night before so neither of us ate a ton, but we did try some items that we didnt have the night before. Enjoyed it. There was no wait this time, we were seated almost immediately.
reviews.title: Really round the world choices
Always good
reviews.text: Service: very attentive. We never had empty glasses, nor dirty plates on our table. They brought us extra napkins without us asking.

reviews.title: 24 hour buffet pass
reviews.text: We at at the rio and enjoyed it very much. Everything was well prepared tasted great and the service was good

reviews.title: Great range!
reviews.text: A bit far to get to, but there is a free shuttle from Ballys hotel. The range on the buffet is amazing! Well worth a visit!

reviews.title: Great buffet

Good choice of food from seafood, pizza, roasts, Mexican, Asian & American cuisine
reviews.title: Great seafood buffet.
Complete Buffet
reviews.text: The Service was fantastic from our waiter

$40. for about $5.00 worth of food. My husband and I couldn't stomach the food in this place. I can't say enough to try to convince you to stay away. The only palatable food was 1 chicken wing and the gelato. Otherwise inedible. Save your money. One note- the wine is exceptionally well priced!!!!!
reviews.title: If the smell of HS cafeteria food is appealing to you- then this is the place for you
Do not waste your money on this buffet
reviews.text: Everywhere you go they advertise how great this "seafood buffet" is. Last week we stayed in Vegas not at Rio, but made the trek there from the strip just for this buffet. We were told from a server at another restaraunt that it was not as good as it used to be, but ignored the advice thinking they didnt want to lose business to other restaraunts. Well 1st off its almost 90 bux for two. What happened to cheap las vegas buffets? 2nd the all you can eat lobster which is what I was looking forward to, is the size of a craw dad and had absolutely no taste to them. I said ok, I'll try other stuff which was mostly fried food. Not worth the money or time. Go elsewhere!!!! I would have rather spent 10 bux at Mickey D's and the other 80 in a slot machine...

reviews.title: Good deal
reviews.text: The food is good. Price is right if you are local. With your Nevada ID you BOGO all the way to an infinite menu of foods from around the world. Their sushi and japanese menu is more than what you find in buffets of the same rank.

reviews.title: Slipping
reviews.text: Have been going to this buffet for years, but the last couple times the food was stale and most of it cooked poorly. Took 30 minutes to seat us even though there were at least 25 tables open. Horrible service when we did get seated with plates piling up on our table for more than twenty minutes. Tried other smaller buffets like Carvings at Harrahs and was way more satisfied.

reviews.title: Great selection of truly fresh food
reviews.text: Many choices of better quality buffet food than most. Not cheap, though we did get a discount through the half-price ticket place. (it wasn't half price though...just a slight discount).

This buffet used to be amazing. The service was poor, the food mediocre, and the price high. I would recommend exploring other places on the strip. The deserts were a small step above a nationwide buffet that serves steak that will remain nameless. This used to be a stop whenever we were in Vegas...won't be anymore.
reviews.title: Bring back the old Rio Buffet
Best Deal in Vegas!
reviews.text: By far the best deal in Vegas when it comes to getting something to eat. First off show your players card for a discount, 2 we got lucky and had a friend from in town with us. with a Vegas ID i think the total as $12 for lunch. The Suishi was delicious as well as the beef cooked meals. Tried a little of everything and ate here 2x in the week. Well worth the money.

Wow!!! What a spread. So many choices and so small of a stomach. I tried everything possible and still didn't get through a third of the place. Anything and everything you could imagine at one place. They have a fired baked pizza this is really good for a buffet. Many other choices that can't go wrong. Quite good for a buffet and definitely will go back next time in Vegas. Craps tables were pretty friendly as well at the Rio. Paid for the buffet and then some.
reviews.title: What a spread. Too many choices. Best everyday buffet in Vegas
Plenty choice but mediocre
reviews.text: You can eat until you drop but some items are poor quality. Worth a visit though and get $10 off by buying your voucher from half-price tkt booth for $2 (ie you pay $20 at venue.

perfect buffet. you'll have too many options to go hungry. Go for the carving station. SO many great options. Skip the asian soup. Boring. But I must admit this must have been THE BEST dessert bar out of the buffets we tried. There is a divine chocolate cake (be careful though, there is hazelnut, which is not marked on the signage! TSK TSK!), and the gelato is wonderful.
reviews.title: YUM!!!
